acute_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Acute
acute_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: It carried out the outside of Category from 96-hour ErC50=169mg/L of algae (Scenedesmus) (IUCLID, 2000).

acute_toxicity_dermal.rationale: Since death was not acknowledged in the test in which 2000mg/kg was dermally exposed for 24 hours to skin of rabbits (NTP TR 518 (2004)), it was set as the outside of Category.

acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.hazard_name: Acute toxicity Inhalation: Dusts and mists

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale: Calculated based on rat LD50 values: 8680mg/kg, 9110mg/kg (ACGIH 7th, 2001), 8000 to 9110 mg/kg (PATTY 4th, 1994), 8000 to 9000 mg/kg, and 4200 to 11300 mg/kg (NTP TR 518, 2004). Since the calculated value was 7269.3 mg/kg, it was set as the outside of Category.

carcinogenicity.rationale: Since it was classified into the group 3 in IARC 77 (2000), it considered as the outside of Category.

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Long-term
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Since not water-insoluble (water solubility=1.00*106mg/L(PHYSPROP Database, 2005)) and acute toxicity is low.

explosives.rationale: There are no chemical groups associated with explosive properties present in the molecules.

flammable_gases.hazard_name: Flammable gases including chemically unstable gases

germ_cell_mutagenicity.rationale: Since there was a negative result with the micronucleus test on mice red corpuscles which is a in vivo mutagenicity test using somatic cells (IARC 77, 2000 and NTP TR 518, 2004), it was classified as out of Category.

oxidizing_liquids.rationale: Organic compounds containing oxygen (but not chlorine and fluorine) chemically bonded only to carbon and hydrogen (but not to other elements).

pyrophoric_liquids.rationale: It is known not to ignite spontaneously from the experience in manufacturing or treatment, even if it contacts the normal temperature air.

reproductive_toxicity.rationale: It was considered as out of Category based on the description that effect was not observed on sperm and the female estroul cycle in the rat or mouse 13-weeks dermal administration test at dose of 2000mg/kg or more (IARC 77 (2000)), description that affect to a fetal/pup was not observed in the pregnant mouse oral administration test at dose of 1125mg /kg (NTP TR 518 (2004)), and the description that affect was not observed on fertile potential and to offsprings in the test which carried out dermal administration of the 500mg/kg to the ratand  2000mg/kg to mice from premating to lactation periods ends (IARC 77 (2000) and NTP TR 518 (2004) ) .

self_heating_substances.rationale: Test methods applicable to liquid substances are not available

self_reactive_substances.rationale: There are no chemical groups associated with explosive or self-reactive properties present in the molecule.

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale: There is the description that in the eye irritation tests using the rabbit, irritation was asknowledged and it recovered completely 14 days afterward (ACGIH (7th, 2001), PATTY (4th, 1994), and NTP TR 518 (2004)). So it was set as Category 2A.

skin_corrosion_irritation.rationale: It was set as Category 2 from description that skin irritation was acknowledged by high exposure levels or repeated exposure in the humans (ACGIH (7th, 2001), SIDS (2005), IARC 77 (2000), NTP TR 518 (2004)).

skin_sensitizer.hazard_statement: May cause an allergic skin reaction
skin_sensitizer.rationale: We classified it as Category 1 based on the description that there are reports of allergic contact dermatitis in human in ACGIH (7th, 2001), IARC 77 (2000), and NTP TR 518 (2004).

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures which, in contact with water, emit flammable gases
substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.rationale: The chemical structure of the substance does not contain metals or metaloids(B, Si, P, Ge, As, Se, Sn, Sb, Te, Bi, Po, At).

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Repeated exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.rationale: Regarding the descriptions that major toxicity was not observed in dermal, oral, or an inhalation exposure test using rats, mice, or guinea pigs with the given dose of the guidance value range of Caegory 2, and it was set to out of Category (ACGIH (7th, 2001), PATTY (4th, 1994), in IARC 77 (2000) and NTP TR 518 (2004)).

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Single exposure
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_statement: May cause respiratory irritation (respiratory tract irritation)
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.rationale: It was set as Category 3 (respiratory irritant) from description that vapor stimulates a nose as effect on the humans in NTP TR 518 (2004).
